ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: A good course to learn the basics of international economics class, much like an undergraduate class.

Economics 702 01 is a very broad class, that covers micro and macro aspects of international economics. I would definitely recommend it to another student; there's a good balance between quantitative and qualitative analysis.
Yes it helped me understand international economics better

I would recommend it. The instructor is amazing and the material is engaging. The math content is low and analysis is often intuition and graph driven, which is relatively slippery, but all in all a great course.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It increased a lot my knowledge of international trade in particular.
A replication of my undergraduate class

It helped me understand how linkages between nations determine their outcomes, which is extremely relevant for any student of development and policy making. The practical content of the course makes it a very useful addition to my skill set.
